meanings.definition: Relating to the science of dynamics.
meanings.sent1: The dynamical system in physics shows how objects move.
meanings.sent2: The dynamical analysis of the experiment helped predict the outcome.
meanings.sent3: The dynamical equations were so complex that even the professor got confused.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a dynamical whirlwind of ideas and theories.
meanings.sent5: The dynamical nature of the universe is both fascinating and challenging to understand.

meanings.definition: Characterized by constant change or activity.
meanings.sent1: The dynamical market trends require quick decision-making.
meanings.sent2: Living in a dynamical city like New York keeps you on your toes.
meanings.sent3: The dynamical weather made planning a picnic nearly impossible.
meanings.sent4: His dynamical personality always kept the office environment lively.
meanings.sent5: The dynamical rhythm of the music energized the crowd at the concert.
